1.title: Viva La Pachanga

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

1.plot: Lishy Lou and Lucky are throwing a party for their guests (the audience). They've never thrown a party before and Lishy Lou is nervous that it won't be very fun.

2.title: Thingamajig

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

2.plot: While Lishy Lou and Lucky are setting up for their dance party,Lishy Lou gets excited and accidentally knocks Thingamajig offline. Not to worry. One of Lishy Lou's talents is she's an engineer. She gets Thingamajig smiling again in no time.

3.title: Lines and Dots

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

3.plot: Lishy Lou and Lucky are throwing a pirate parrrty. Lishy Lou and Lucky write an email to their friends promising to use this technology to contact them from now on. The treehouse then rocks out dance party-style to "Lines and Dots".

4.title: Gato Astronauto

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

4.plot: Lishy Lou wanders into the party just a tad late. She was busy daydreaming about going to space. Lucky encourages her to put her engineering skills to use and make Thingamajig into a rocket so they can soar amongst the stars.

5.title: Say What?

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

5.plot: Lishy Lou can't catch her breath and Thingamajig reminds Lucky that water would make her feel better. Lishy Lou hydrates - "hydration station!" - and all is well again. Lishy Lou, Lucky, and their guests have a "Say What?" dance party.

6.title: Little Red Rooster

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

6.plot: The treehouse is converted into a barn. They invite their guests in and surprise them with a hoedown. "Little Red Rooster" plays as they all have a dance party hoedown-style.

7.title: 8000 Feet

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

7.plot: Inspired by Amelia Earhart's story, Lishy Lou realizes that with handwork and determination, she can make any of her dreams come true. They all celebrate with a "8000 Feet" dance party.

8.title: Pretty Princess

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

8.plot: Lishy Lou is dressed up as a knight, but Lucky isn't sure what costume to wear. Thingamajig suggests a princess.

9.title: Happy Birthday

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

9.plot: Lishy Lou is throwing a surprise party for Lucky's birthday. Lucky is so surprised that he accidentally knocks the cake Lishy Lou's holding down the front of her dress.

10.title: When I Grow Up

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

10.plot: Lishy Lou has planted seeds for her guests at the party. She's disappointed when she realizes that the seeds haven't grown at all. Thingamajig reminds Lishy Lou and Lucky that the seeds need both water and sunlight to grow.

11.title: Here Comes the Sun

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

11.plot: Lucky is still asleep. Lishy Lou has tried everything to wake him for the party. Thingamajig reminds her about alarm clocks. Lishy Lou uses her engineering skills to turn Thingamajig into an alarm clock. The alarm goes off and Lucky wakes up. He's ready for a "Here Comes the Sun" dance party.

12.title: Shimmy

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

12.plot: It's a cold day in the treehouse. So cold that Lishy Lou freezes solid. Thingamajig reminds Lucky that it's a heater too and it warms Lishy Lou's body back to normal body temperature, 98.6 degrees.

13.title: Jackie

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

13.plot: Lishy Lou and Lucky are warming up-Thingamajig is having a hard time hitting the ball, he doesn't want to play.They remind him about all of the hardships Jackie Robinson had to overcome before he was able to play ball.

15.title: Emergency!

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

15.plot: Lishy Lou and Lucky are camping in their treehouse and decide to start a campfire. Thingamajig objects! Fire isn't a toy, you must take precautions before starting one.

16.title: Blue Bear

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

16.plot: Lishy Lou and Lucky are having storytime at their party today. Lucky has a story prepared, but Lishy Lou is having a crisis of confidence. She's afraid her stories aren't good enough.

17.title: Smiling

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

17.plot: Lishy Lou and Lucky won a bag of fish at the fair. They realize that the fish don't look very happy. Thingamajig suggests they move the fish from the plastic bag to a bowl. The fish smile in their new home.

18.title: Monkey Jones

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

18.plot: Lishy Lou and Lucky are throwing a "dress like your favorite animal-party!" Lucky is dressed like a lion, Thingamajig is dressed like a puppy, and Lishy Lou is dressed like a zoo. Lucky knows Lishy Lou loves all animals but he asks her to just pick one for the party.

19.title: Quite Like

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

19.plot: Lishy Lou can't decide what to wear to today's party. She always wears her red dress because she loves it, but she's afraid everyone is tired of it. Thingamajig reminds her about snowflakes - each is unique in appearance and celebrated for their individuality. Lucky encourages Lishy Lou to wear her red dress if she loves it. She decides he's right. Why not use clothing as a way to express her own personality?

20.title: Explorer

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

20.plot: Lishy Lou and Lucky are exploring the treehouse. Thingamajig reminds them to bring flashlights in their exploration. Lishy Lou and Lucky encourage their guests to explore their own homes too.

21.title: Who Stole the Cookies?

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

21.plot: Lishy Lou has made cookies for the party. Every time she turns around, another one goes missing. Lucky, Thingamajig, and the pet fish have all been stealing her cookies! It's okay, though. She thought everyone would be hungry, so she made an extra batch! Lishy Lou, Lucky, Thingamajig, the fish, and the guests have a "Who Stole the Cookies?" dance party.

22.title: Lemonade Stand

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

22.plot: Lishy Lou wants to charge admission to today's party so she can save up and buy a carousel. Lucky doesn't think it's right to charge the friends they invited to enter their party. He thinks there are other ways to earn money. Thingamajig suggests a lemonade stand. Lishy Lou and Lucky set up the lemonade stand so they can earn money the responsible way. They all celebrate with a "Lemonade Stand" dance party.

23.title: Squirrely the Squirrel

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

23.plot: Lishy Lou is bragging about winning rock, paper, scissors against Lucky. Lucky and Thingamajig remind Lishy Lou that it's not nice to brag when you win because it makes everyone else feel bad. Lishy Lou apologizes to Lucky and her friends and they have a "Squirrely the Squirrel" dance party.

-1.title: Freeze Dance

episode of.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (TV Series 2013– )

-1.plot: It's a cold day in the treehouse. So cold that Lishy Lou freezes solid. Thingamajig reminds Lucky that it's a heater too and it warms Lishy Lou's body back to normal body temperature, 98.6 degrees. They all decide the best way to stay warm is with a "Freeze Dance" dance party!

locations: Evidence Film Studios, Los Angeles, California, USA
imdb.plot outline: "Lishy Lou and Lucky Too" is a children's live-action TV show starring Lishy Lou and Lucky. They live together in a magical treehouse with their dear friend Thingamajig. Each episode, Lishy Lou and Lucky will throw a party for their guests (the audience) that will be based on a theme. Each party has its own unique complications, which will be solved through a lesson inspired by their friend Thingamajig. These lessons teach a variety of social skills, values, and historical facts, depending upon that day's theme. They're a bilingual household (English and Spanish) and each show will end with a dance party inspired by one of the songs from the award winning, "Lucky Diaz and the Family Jam Band." Lishy Lou and Lucky Too integrates music, dancing, Spanish language and creativity for the viewer- which is important for children's overall development. The jump-jiving dance party encourages kids to move and groove and celebrate together!
imdb.title: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too
akas: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too (United States)

other companies.name: Lucky Diaz and the Family Jam Band

plot: Lishy Lou and Lucky get into zany adventures.::RDD

"_Lishy Lou and Lucky Too_ (qv)" is a children's live-action TV show starring Lishy Lou and Lucky. They live together in a magical treehouse with their dear friend Thingamajig. Each episode, Lishy Lou and Lucky will throw a party for their guests (the audience) that will be based on a theme. Each party has its own unique complications, which will be solved through a lesson inspired by their friend Thingamajig. These lessons teach a variety of social skills, values, and historical facts, depending upon that day's theme. They're a bilingual household (English and Spanish) and each show will end with a dance party inspired by one of the songs from the award winning, "Lucky Diaz and the Family Jam Band." _Lishy Lou and Lucky Too_ (qv) integrates music, dancing, Spanish language and creativity for the viewer- which is important for children's overall development. The jump-jiving dance party encourages kids to move and groove and celebrate together!::Carla Cackowski
synopsis: Lishy Lou and Lucky Too is a childrens live-action TV show starring Lishy Lou and Lucky. They live together in a magical treehouse with their dear friend Thingamajig. Each episode, Lishy Lou and Lucky will throw a party for their guests (the audience) that will be based on a theme. Each party has its own unique complications, which will be solved through a lesson inspired by their friend Thingamajig. These lessons teach a variety of social skills, values, and historical facts, depending upon that days theme. Theyre a bilingual household (English and Spanish) and each show will end with a dance party inspired by one of the songs from the award winning, Lucky Diaz and the Family Jam Band. Lishy Lou and Lucky Too integrates music, dancing, spanish language and creativity for the viewer- which is important for childrens overall development. The jump-jiving dance party encourages kids to move and groove and celebrate together!By: Carla Cackowski
